CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Analogous event has also been realized in D-A type of oligomers and polymers based on 3,4bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)thiophene or 2-ethylhexyloxy-substituted 3,4-propylenedioxythiophene as donor and BT as acceptor , which demonstrated that with the depleting composition of BT unit along the conjugated backbone , the dual absorbing bands were induced to move toward the maximum absorption ( λ max ) of the all - donor homopolymer that located in between of the dual absorbance.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| 3,4bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)thiophene |
| 2-ethylhexyloxy-substituted 3,4-propylenedioxythiophene |
| BT (benzothiophene) |
| all-donor homopolymer |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| 3,4bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)thiophene |
| 2-ethylhexyloxy-substituted 3,4-propylenedioxythiophene |

I have removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to "Material Name":

* "dual absorbing bands" (this is a phenomenon, not a material name)
* "depleting composition" (this is a term, not a material name)
* "all-donor homopolymer" (this is a term, not a material name)
